column4: so I'm trying to install edgy from CD and when I go into the run/install it goes though the ubuntu loadinng screen but the it dissapears, and the screen goes black never to return
I've tried to go into graphics safe mode to no avail
huh, now that is interesting. I'd search for your video card or your system model in the Ubuntu forums.
I'm not seeing anthing in the forums about my issue, can you offer anyother suggestions?
besides Google, and making your own thread at the Ubuntu forums, no.
where there are no answers to be found, none can be given.
IOW, if searching doesn't work, then I can't help beyond that. Others may know, I don't.
yes, when you see the "3, 2, 1" countdown on startup, hit ESC, and choose recovery mode.
I never see a "1 2 3" count down with this live disk
right right
when you get in the live cd, you should see something like "F6 Other Options".
when you get that, erase the "--" and "quiet" and "splash" and type in "single".
then punch enter. Basically, you manually told the livecd to run recovery mode.
alright, try apt-getting the fglrx driver
oh, ok
yes!
don't get too happy! edgy'll dash your hopes in a moment.
where is the install script on the live cd?
lol, why?
you should be able to install straight from gnome
I recommend typing Ctrl+Alt+F1, killing gnome, and typing exit.
alright!
I TOLD you X would complain. :D
